Comment: I'm a veteran and I think this is wrong. Veterans day is a day that I, and many other veterans and service members, had to earn. We celebrate our living vets with Veterans Day and Memorial Day is to remember our fallen soldiers, sailors, marines, and airmen.   However, from a historic perspective, we used to celebrate armistice day on Nov 11th. [wiki link](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armistice_Day)  Kurt Vonnegut shared his thoughts on this too, [Armistice Day has become Veterans’ Day. Armistice Day was sacred. Veterans’ Day is not.](https://www.loa.org/news-and-views/kurt-vonnegut-armistice-day-and-veterans-day/#:~:text=I%20will%20come%20to%20a,sacred%20day%20called%20Armistice%20Day.) My thoughts on this quote is around how Veterans Day has become a day for consumerism and not about our veterans.   We have no one left to celebrate Armistice Day, but we have countless veterans all suffering.   The GOP, Trump, and their supporters have showed us time and time again how much they do not care for veterans. My healthcare with the VA has suffered, my job as a federal employee is threatened, I have lost friends and shipmates with no one trying to fix anything to help us.   Trump is ripping away safety nets from veterans with threatened homes. [Trump's VA strands thousands of veterans by ending a key mortgage program](https://www.npr.org/2025/05/01/nx-s1-5382448/va-veterans-affairs-mortgages-foreclosure-vasp)  These people do not care about us [suckers and losers.](https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2020/09/trump-americans-who-died-at-war-are-losers-and-suckers/615997/)
Author: TheEverydayDad

Comment: For me, the military was the only option to get a job skill and money for college.   I believe our constitution is what has made our country amazing and allowed for some great things, but the country itself is still flawed. Politics, ignorance, education all play a factor into it.   I didn't join because I saw the country as this glorious infallible giant, but for my own reasons. And I recognize and criticize our country and its leaders for what they are - imprefect and mildly corrupt (or more depending on who you review). In turn, I've gained a lot from my service and respect everyone who's served.   Now, I own a house, got my wife through medical school, and have 2 kids all thanks to the sacrifices I made by joining the military. I wish those benefits were available to every American - including those who cannot serve. There is a lot we need to do to give opportunities to all citizens and the GOP has never been one to do that.
Author: TheEverydayDad
